sentences.en: A royal edict, just issued, offered protection to the teachers of the new doctrine.
sentences.cn: 这时国王正颁布了一道保护传讲新教之人的命令.

sentences.en: An imperial edict is a writ in the name of an emperor.
sentences.cn: 诏书是以皇帝名义发布指令的专用文书.

sentences.en: An official or authoritarian declaration a proclamation or an edict.
sentences.cn: 宣言,公告官方或权威性的宣布;公告或法令.

sentences.en: And edict is retroactive, covering 131 companies that have listed on mainland stock markets since 2005.
sentences.cn: 这项法令将追溯实行, 涉及2005年以来在中国内地证交所上市的131家公司.

sentences.en: He handed his trusted follower the unsealed imperial edict to his favourite.
sentences.cn: 他把露布交给了他的亲信.

sentences.en: He issued an edict that none of his writings be destroyed.
sentences.cn: 他下令不得毁坏他的任何作品。

sentences.en: In 1741 Catherine the Great issued an edict of toleration for Buddhism.
sentences.cn: 1741年，叶卡捷琳娜大帝颁布法令，允许佛教的存在。

sentences.en: Some days later , Prefect Tu recieved an imperial edict.
sentences.cn: 就这时,杜太守接到圣旨,因金人南侵, 将他升任安抚使,镇守淮扬.

sentences.en: Stubbs the plasterer was much downcast at this dreadful edict.
sentences.cn: 泥水匠斯塔布斯对这道使人敬畏的“法令”十分沮丧.

sentences.en: The edict was subject to many interpretations.
sentences.cn: 那项法令可以有很多种诠释.

sentences.en: The emperor issued an edict forbidding anyone to leave the city.
sentences.cn: 皇帝下令禁止任何人出城。

sentences.en: The emperor issued an edict forbidding doing trade with foreigners.
sentences.cn: 皇帝颁布了一项不得和外国人做生意的敕令.

sentences.en: The revocation of the Edict of Nantes was signed here in 1685.
sentences.cn: 1685年南特敕令的废除是在这里宣布的.

sentences.en: The support team has an edict to provide a Linux client in 2005.
sentences.cn: 维护小组已经宣布2005年要提供Linux客户端.

sentences.en: Therefore King Darius signed the writing , that is, the edict.
sentences.cn: 9于是 大利乌王 签署了这禁令的文书.

sentences.en: They caballed against the emperor's edict.
sentences.cn: 他们密谋反对皇帝的谕旨.

trans.tran_en: an official public order made by someone in a position of power
